TÖÖVÕTULEPING 9A/431

31.01.2024

Käesoleva töövõtulepingu (edaspidi: Leping) on sõlminud pooled AS BCS Koolitus, keda esindab Anni Sild, edaspidi TELLIJA, ja Ilja Grigorjev, edaspidi TÖÖVÕTJA, järgmistel tingimustel:

LEPINGU OBJEKT 

Lepingu objektiks on Java juunior arendaja e-õppe kursuse I etapi väljatöötamine. I etapis määratakse kindlaks milliseid tehnilisi oskusi õpetatakse ning sõnastatakse see osa õppekavast; koostatakse Java arendaja e-õppe kursuse struktuur; pannakse paika kursuse raames õpetatavate oskuste loogiline järjestus ning ülesanded, mida õpetatakse kursusel osalejatele, et nad saavutaksid loodavas õppekavas kokku lepitud tehnilise osa õpiväljundid; kaardistatakse ja lepitakse kokku kogu vajalik sisend materjalide tootmise teekaardi loomiseks (edaspidi nimetatud TÖÖ). 

Pooled on kokku leppinud, et TÖÖ maht ei saa olla suurem kui 45 astronoomilist tundi.



TÄHTAEG

TÖÖ teostamise tähtaeg on 16.02.2024. 

LEPINGU HIND

TELLIJA kohustub maksma TÖÖVÕTJALE punktis 1.1 nimetatud TÖÖ eest brutotasu (edaspidi TASU) 30€ (kolmkümmend eurot) ühe astronoomilise tunni eest. TELLIJA kohustub maksuseadustes sätestatud määras ja korras tasust kinni pidama tulumaksu, töötuskindlustusmaksu ja kohustusliku kogumispensioni makse. Tööandja maksab tasult sotsiaalmaksu, millist summat ei arvestata tasust maha

Punktis 3.1. märgitud TASU kantakse TÖÖVÕTJA pangakontole 
EE497700771002916557 LHV TÖÖ eest 7 päeva jooksul peale TÖÖ  üleandmist punktis 4.4 kokkulepitul viisil.

TÖÖVÕTJA KOHUSTUSED 

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub teostama Lepingus kokkulepitud TÖÖ.

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub teostama TÖÖ vastavuses Lepingu, kehtivate õigusaktidega ja muude TÖÖ tegemist reguleerivate dokumentidega.

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub viivitamatult teatama TELLIJALE kõigist TÖÖ teostamisega seotud olulistest ja takistavatest asjaoludest, mis võivad mõjutada või mõjutavad TÖÖ tähtaegselt valmimist või TÖÖ teostamist vastavalt Lepingu tingimustele ja/või mille vastu on või võib olla TELLIJAL äratuntav oluline huvi.  

TÖÖVÕTJA annab punktis 1.1 kirjeldatud TÖÖ teostamise käigus loodud kursuse struktuuri, tehnilise osa õppekava ning sisendi materjalide tootmise teekaardi loomiseks üle failidena, mille sobilik formaat lepitakse eraldi kokku töö käigus.

    

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub kasutama TELLIJALT saadud Informatsiooni ainult Poolte vahel kokkulepitud ulatuses ja eesmärkide saavutamiseks ning mitte edastama saadud Informatsiooni kolmandatele isikutele.



AUTORIÕIGUS

TÖÖVÕTJA kinnitab, et TÖÖ autor või autorid on loovutanud või loovutavad oma varalised õigused töölepingu või muu kirjaliku lepinguga TÖÖVÕTJALE ning on piiranud või piiravad oma autoriõiguse seaduses nimetatud isiklike õiguste teostamise viisi ja ulatust TÖÖVÕTJAGA sõlmitud kirjaliku lepinguga nii, et TELLIJAL on õigus kasutada TÖÖD käesolevas Lepingus sätestatud ulatuses ja viisil.  

TÖÖVÕTJA loovutab TELLIJALE kõik autori varalised õigused TÖÖLE ilma geograafiliste piiranguteta ning kogu autoriõiguse kehtivuse tähtajaks ilma piiranguteta kolmandate isikute suhtes. 

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub tagama, et TÖÖ autor teostab Lepingu kehtivuse ajal oma autoriõiguse seadusest tulenevaid isiklikke õigusi vastavalt allpool toodule. 

Õigus autorsusele - autor võib esineda TÖÖ autorina;

Õigus autorinimele - autor on lubanud TÖÖ kasutamist autori andmete näitamiseta TÖÖ juures.

Kui TELLIJA on teostanud õigusi TÖÖD täiendada või muuta, on autoril õigus nõuda enda isiku TÖÖGA seostamise lõpetamist, kuid autor on loobunud vaidlustamast TÖÖS tehtud täiendusi või muudatusi.

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub TÖÖD mitte avaldama ilma TELLIJA eelneva kirjaliku loata. TÖÖVÕTJA võib avaldatud TÖÖD kasutada viisil ja ulatuses, mis ei ole vastuolus käesoleva lepingu sätete, mõtte ja eesmärkidega.

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub mitte pakkuma TÖÖGA äravahetamiseni sarnaseid töid kolmandatele isikutele.

Kui autor ei järgi lepingu punktides 5.3. ja 5.4. sätestatut, on tegemist TÖÖVÕTJA poolse Lepingu rikkumisega ning TELLIJAL on õigus nõuda lepingu rikkumisega tekitatud kahju hüvitamist. 

TÖÖVÕTJA kohustub mitte lisama TÖÖLE või kasutama TÖÖS kolmandate isikute autoriõigusega kaitstud teoseid või muid intellektuaalomandi õigustega kaitstud objekte ilma nende autori või omaniku ning TELLIJA eelneva kirjaliku nõusolekuta.



TELLIJA KOHUSTUSED

TELLIJA kohustub maksma Lepinguga kooskõlas teostatud TÖÖ eest Lepingu p-s 3.1 ja 3.2 kokkulepitud TASU.

TELLIJA kohustub kokkulepitud tingimustele vastava TÖÖ TÖÖVÕTJALT vastu võtma.

LEPINGU MUUTMINE

Muudatused Lepingus tuleb vormistada kirjalikult.

TELLIJA poolsed Lepingu muudatused TÖÖ sisus võivad kaasa tuua muudatusi Lepingu hinnas ja/või tähtajas.

VASTUTUS

TELLIJA peab teatama TÖÖ Lepingu tingimustele mittevastavusest TÖÖVÕTJALE mõistliku aja jooksul pärast seda, kui ta töö Lepingu tingimustele mittevastavusest teada sai või pidi teada saama ning kirjeldama sama tähtaja jooksul piisavalt täpselt TÖÖ Lepingu tingimustele mittevastavust.

LÕPPSÄTTED

Leping jõustub selle allkirjastamisel.

Lepingu pooled peavad Lepingut täitma heas usus, vastavuses heade kommetega ja hea tavaga.

Vaidlused, mis tekivad Lepingu täitmise käigus, lahendatakse läbirääkimiste teel ja kokkuleppel. Kui pooled kokkulepet ei saavuta, lahendatakse vaidlus Eesti Vabariigi seadustes ettenähtud korras.

Project overview

General 

Today, it is important to make it easy for restaurants to take food and drink orders and meet government requirements regarding customers' data protection. UK and US state governments are now mandating in many areas that restaurants hold a temporary record of customer details, including name, phone number, and email address, and store them securely for around 21 days.

Our customer Bella Pizzeria has decided to build a food ordering application that will allow contactless ordering. in the restaurant (replacing the physical menu). The app must provide a customer with an overview of all the food and drink available in the restaurant, accept orders, and securely store customer data to comply with GDPR and data privacy laws.

The main functionalities of this app are:

Contactless ordering for customers to keep staff safe

No download required, just scan a QR code or enter a web address

Browse the menu, and order food and drinks

Simple product management

Contact Tracing securely records customer data and meets privacy laws.

Overview of main features

Browse products & ordering

Upload your products including name, images, allergy information, product highlights, etc

Customers can browse, search and filter products by category e.g. Hot Drinks

Products can be edited anytime and are instantly updated

Customers can add products to their orders and adjust the quantities

Customers can see their order details and total price before ordering

Customers receive an email summary of their order

Managing orders

When orders are submitted they are visible on a screen for staff members

The order list can be displayed on a tablet or computer

Orders include the table and customer details in case you need to discuss the order with the customer

Orders can be marked as completed or declined once they are processed

When orders are submitted they are visible on a screen for staff members

The order list can be displayed on a tablet or computer

Contact Tracing features

The app collects the recommended customer information: name, email and telephone

Staff can access the customer data if the governing body requests it

The app includes a button for deleting customer and order data over 21 days old

Data is stored inline with GDPR privacy laws

Access features

Print instructions from the app that you can give to your customers

Instant access by scanning a QR code or entering a web address

Web app available for free, and Apple/Android mobile app available as an upgrade

The app works on smartphones, tablets and computer

General project description

This project is an introductory project for the Manual QA course. Its goal is to give a student a general understanding of the testing process and guide him through the main steps and techniques.

The main goal is to build a simple food ordering application where the student will participate in the Manual QA role. The process will be organised using the following tools:

Fliplet - will be used to build the web application and conduct the testing (https://fliplet.com/food-ordering/ ).

https://studio.fliplet.com/apps/25250/edit/components

L: andres@cerebrumhub.com

P: Cerebrumhub.123

Jira - organisation of the agile development and testing, including reporting of the bugs.

Confluence - used for documentation management (use cases, test cases, etc.).

Quality requirements: 

The summary field which represents the title, is clear enough to understand what’s this bug is about

preferably, has the page/component name

short high-level description of the bug

Structural blocks of the Description field can be clearly distinguished

block names are highlighted with formatting - bold font, text style

Steps are numbered, and numbering is correct - this way it’s easier to follow and qa can refer to steps numbers in expected result

The issue is reproducible, description is understandable and clear

If links are used - they lead you to the correct version of the application (in fliplet projects we have separate instance of the app sitting on a certain url)

The screenshot has all necessary information highlighted, preferably in red (incorrect), green (correct) colors.

How to provide constructive feedback on the results of other teams

Navigate to Confluence and find a project with the name “Restaurant food delivery project”.

Open the workspace of the team with the number that is next to your team number.

If your Team number is 1, then take teams 2 and 3.

For every team that you are assessing open the page “Testing checklists”.

Quality requirements: 

The summary field which represents the title, is clear enough to understand what’s this bug is about

preferably, has the page/component name

short high-level description of the bug

block names are highlighted with formatting - bold font, text style

The issue is reproducible, description is understandable and clear

If links are used - they lead you to the correct version of the application (in fliplet projects we have separate instance of the app sitting on a certain url)

The screenshot has all necessary information highlighted, preferably in red (incorrect), green (correct) colours.

Use cases

UC1. Menu browsing with search

Description

This functionality allows the user to see a menu (list of products) provided by the restaurant. The user can use search functions to filter the menu by various categories.

Roles and permissions

No restrictions - every public user can use it.

Business logic

The user must be able to see a list of all products (menu) provided by the restaurant on the same page.

The user must see the following information about every product:

Product name

Product price

Product size (that may vary for different products)

The user must see the label “Out of stock” if the product is not available.

The list of products must be sorted by the product name.

The user must be able to search products by their name - full-text search or partial search.

The user must be able to filter the list of products by the following parameters:

Category: Available categories are “Cold drinks”, “Desserts”, “Hot drinks”, “Pasta”, “Pizza”, “Salads”, “Soups”, Starters”.

Highlight: “House special”, “Spicy”, “Vegan”, “Vegetarian”.

Roles and permissions

No restrictions - every public user can use it.

Business logic

The user must be able to see a list of all products (menu) provided by the restaurant on the same page.

The user must see the following information about every product:

Product name

Product price

Product size (that may vary for different products)

The user must see the label “Out of stock” if the product is not available.

The list of products must be sorted by the product name.

The user must be able to search products by their name - full-text search or partial search.

The user must be able to filter the list of products by the following parameters:

Category: Available categories are “Cold drinks”, “Desserts”, “Hot drinks”, “Pasta”, “Pizza”, “Salads”, “Soups”, Starters”.

Highlight: “House special”, “Spicy”, “Vegan”, “Vegetarian”.

Allergy Information: “Eggs”, “Gluten”, “Milk”.

The user must be able to apply one or multiple filtering parameters at the same time.

 

UC2. Previewing products

Description

This functionality allows the user to see detailed information about the product.

Roles and permissions

No restrictions - every public user can use it.

Business logic

The user can access the product preview from the product list described in the UC1.

The user must see the following information about every product:

Product picture

Product name

Product price

Product size (that may vary for different products)

Product category

Product highlight - at least one value should exist

Product description - comma separated list

Product allergy information

The user must see “Out of stock” label, if the opened product is not available for ordering.

UC3. Ordering products

Description

This functionality allows the user to add one or several products to the order. The user must be also able to review and change the order by adding or deleting some products.

After the order is completed the user can submit it by providing additional data required by the restaurant.

Roles and permissions

No restrictions - every public user can use it.

Business logic

Adding products to the order

The user must be able to add the product to the order by clicking “+” button from the menu or product preview screen.

The user must be able to add the same product several times.

The user must not be able to order products, that are out of stock.

Viewing and changing the order

The user must be able to preview the order and see all products added to it.

The user must see the amount of added products and the total price per product.

The user must see the total price of all added products to the order (in euros).

The user must be able to change (increase or decrease) the amount of added product.

The user must be able to delete the product from the order.

The user must be able to go back to the menu screen using “Back” button.

Submitting order

The user needs to submit the order to confirm it and send it to the restaurant.

Following additional information must be entered before the user can submit the order:

Table number

Information about possible allergies

Name of the customer

Phone number of the customer

Email of the customer (the system must validate, that format is correct - email@domain.com).

The customer must see the notice that personal data is collected as part of government requirements.

Exact text: “As part of the GDPR requirements, please complete the following fields. We will delete your information after the required 21 day holding period.”

The user must press “Submit order” button to confirm the order.

If some mandatory fields were not filled, then an appropriate error message must be shown to the user.

After the order submission, the user must see a confirmation page.

The confirmation page must show the list of ordered products together with quantities.

The confirmation page must show the total price of the order.

The user must be able to navigate back to the Menu.

After the submission, the user must receive an email with the order confirmation. The email must be sent to the email address entered in the 2.e.

 

UC4. Login to the administration panel

Description

This functionality allows the manager or administrator of the restaurant to log in to the administration panel, where he/she can manage orders, products and other settings.

Roles and permissions

Administrator

Business logic

All users must see the “Login as administrator” button at the bottom of the menu.

The “Login as administrator” button must navigate the user to the authentication page.

The user must be automatically redirected to the administration panel if he was previously already logged in.

The user must enter an Email and Password to access the administration panel.

The confirmation page must show the list of ordered products together with quantities.

The confirmation page must show the total price of the order.

The user must be able to navigate back to the Menu.

After the submission, the user must receive an email with the order confirmation. The email must be sent to the email address entered in the 2.e.

 

UC4. Login to the administration panel

Description

This functionality allows the manager or administrator of the restaurant to log in to the administration panel, where he/she can manage orders, products and other settings.

Roles and permissions

Administrator

Business logic

All users must see the “Login as administrator” button at the bottom of the menu.

The “Login as administrator” button must navigate the user to the authentication page.

The user must be automatically redirected to the administration panel if he was previously already logged in.

The user must enter an Email and Password to access the administration panel.

The email field must have a validation - entered value must contain the “@” symbol + contain domain extension (example: @domain.com).

If the email is wrong following error message must be shown: “Please enter a valid email.“

If the user entered the Email, that doesn’t exist in the system, the following error message must be shown: “The email address could not be found.”

If the wrong password was entered for the existing Email, the following error message must be shown: “Your email or password don't match. Please try again.”

The user must be redirected to the administration panel if the correct email and password were entered.

 

Credentials for testing

Login: admin@email.com
Password: admin

 

UC5. Viewing and managing orders

Description

This functionality allows the manager or administrator of the restaurant to see all orders of the restaurant and manage them. The manager can complete or decline the order according to the situation.

Roles and permissions

Administrator

Preconditions

The user must be successfully authenticated.

At least one order must be created and submitted to the restaurant.

Business logic

Viewing orders

The administrator can navigate to the orders list by clicking the “View orders” button.

The administrator must see the list of all orders in status “Open”.

The administrator can filter orders by status to see “Completed” and “Declined” orders.

The following information must be shown about every order in the list view:

Table number

Total number of ordered products

Order time.

The list of orders must be sorted by “Order time”. The newest orders must be at the top of the list.

The administrator can click on the order, to see its detailed information. Here the administrator can see all the details provided by the customer in UC3.

The administrator must be able to go back to the list of all orders by using “Back” button.

Completing and declining orders

The administrator must see buttons “Complete” and “Decline” in the order’s detailed information view.

The status of the order must change if the administrator clicks one of the buttons.

The order must move to the appropriate section in the orders list view.

 

UC6. Product management

Adding products

Description

This functionality allows the administrator to add new product to the menu.

Roles and permissions

Administrator - only administrator user must be able to access this functionalities.

Business logic

The administrator must be able to see the button “Add new product” in the administration menu (after logging in to the administration panel).

The administrator must be able to add the following information:

Product name - required text field, cannot be longer that 50 symbols.

Is product out of the stock or not. (Radio button Yes/No).

Description - required text field.

Category - required dropdown with options “Cold drinks”, “Desserts”, “Hot drinks”, “Pasta”, “Pizza”, “Salads”, “Soups”, Starters”.

Highlight - optional dropdown with options “House special”, “Spicy”, “Vegan”, “Vegetarian”.

Price - required number element.

Size - required text element.

Unit type - mandatory dropdown with options “serve”, “ml”, “cl”, “litre”, “kg”, “small”, “medium”, “large”, “extra large”.

Image - the administrator must be able to upload image in formats “jpg” or “png”.

Allergy information - required dropdown with options Celery, Gluten, Eggs, Fish, Lupin, Milk, Molluscs, Mustard, Nuts, Sesame, Soybeans, Sulphur dioxide and sulphites

The administrator must press Save button to add a new product. The system must prevent adding products in case some required information is not entered.

Highlight - optional dropdown with options “House special”, “Spicy”, “Vegan”, “Vegetarian”.

Price - required number element.

Size - required text element.

Unit type - mandatory dropdown with options “serve”, “ml”, “cl”, “litre”, “kg”, “small”, “medium”, “large”, “extra large”.

Image - the administrator must be able to upload image in formats “jpg” or “png”.

Allergy information - required dropdown with options Celery, Gluten, Eggs, Fish, Lupin, Milk, Molluscs, Mustard, Nuts, Sesame, Soybeans, Sulphur dioxide and sulphites

The administrator must press Save button to add a new product. The system must prevent adding products in case some required information is not entered.

The newly added product must appear in the menu as described in the UC1.

Editing product details

Description

This functionality allows the administrator to edit information of previosly added product.

Roles and permissions

Administrator - only administrator user must be able to access this functionalities.

Business logic

The administrator must be able to edit product details by opening its in the menu. The administrator must see “Edit” button, that must be hidden for other users.





 

The administrator must be able to change all fields of the product. The fields and validations must work in the same way as they described in the “Adding products” scenario.

The administrator must be able to cancel editing by pressing “Cancel” button.

The administrator must be able to save new data by pressing “Save” button. After saving the administrator must be redirected to the Menu page.

Deleting a product 

Description

This functionality allows the administrator to delete previosly added product.

Roles and permissions

Administrator - only administrator user must be able to access this functionalities.

Business logic

The administrator must be able to delete product by opening its in the menu. The administrator must see “Delete” button, that must be hidden for other users.





 

The confirmation window must appear if administrator is pressing “Delete” button. By confirming the action the administrator must be able to delete the product and it should not appear any more in the menu for other users.

Exactly. After regression testing in a newly released version, in case a bug is already fixed, it means the testing result is ‘Passed’. The bug report related to this bug should be closed and the testing result shown on the report of course will also be ‘Passed’. The closed bug report link is not necessary to be included in the final testing report.

Actually there is not a big problem if you really want to indicate the passed functionalities which need improvement with yellow color. Potentially it could be misleading especially when you also had a bug report link beside.

To answer your 3rd and 4th question, I can provide you with our assessment criteria for the final testing report. This assessment criteria can give you an overview what should be included and some rules to follow to make a decent report.
